At this hour at this minute on this day in the year 2002 â€” Jan. 23, 2002 â€” a young man stepped out of a car to walk into a compound on the outskirts of Karachi, Pakistan, believing he was about to do an interview with a Muslim cleric. 

Instead, a man named Attaur Rehman grabbed him and pointed a gun at his head. 

Poor, innocent Danny Pearl, then just 38, asked sincerely: â€œIs this security?â€

Security, he thought for the sheikh. 

No, dear Danny, this was an abduction in a scheme by this deluded militant, Omar Sheikh, just 28. 

It was an operation in which you were a â€œtarget of opportunity,â€ but I will explain this to you tomorrow when I share how we discovered how you had been trapped.

For now, I will explain what you didnâ€™t know â€” none of us knew â€” when you left my house on Zamzama Street hours earlier, a family of parrots squawking overhead.

You were on the hunt to find the man who was the local facilitator in Pakistan for Richard Reid, the â€œshoe bomber.â€ Farah Stockman, now at the New York Times, reported in the Boston Globe that it was this Sheikh Gilani. You were chasing the story, and Farah, to this day, regrets she got the story wrong. I regret it too. Those are the mistakes that happen. 

You were trying to talk to Gilani directly. In this hour, your wife Mariane knew something was wrong. You didnâ€™t answer your phone.

You always answered your phone. They took your phone. They chained you to a car engine. The guards later told the police you were confused. 

They took your clothes. They brought you a 1970s warmup jacket and made you change into it. You were confused. 

Oh poor dear Danny. We are in that compound with you, although the years have passed and you are not there anymore. We are with you, dear friend. Now and always. 

This is the photo they sent of you. I want to ask the world: can you see Dannyâ€™s middle finger at his terrorists? That is the message that I received. 

Fight the jerks, the militants, the extremists, the terrorists. 

Show them the middle finger. Defeat them with will power, intellect and heart.

You, Danny, could not do so in body, but I know you are with us, Danny, in spirit, so we can prevail to know the world you were always trying to both realize and celebrate.  

Take Dannyâ€™s symbolic gesture with you, friends, real or imagined, to give yourself courage and determination. It has fueled me for the 21 years since, and we will use our courage to defeat the ideology and hate that seized this innocent man from the streets. For Danny.

xoxo

Daniel Pearl's last words were: "I am #Jewish."
We remember his legacy as we continue to speak out against extremism in all forms, including #antisemitism.

Germany: Educators and social workers are discovering to their dismay that it is all but impossible to â€œintegrateâ€ young Muslim immigrants into German society.

Ark spokesman warns against radical young people

Teachers and social workers are sounding the alarm: Arab young people are becoming more and more radical. Islamism has long since won in some migrant milieus.

â€œGermany will soon be ours.â€ The sentence scares Wolfgang BÃ¼scher, and the man is hardly afraid of anything else.

The spokesman for the childrenâ€™s and youth organization â€œArkâ€ says, â€œWe are facing a catastrophe.â€ â€œArkâ€ looks after 7,000 children and young people from socially disadvantaged families every day in 33 facilities across the country. It is one of the largest aid organizations in the country.

More than 60% of the protÃ©gÃ©s have a so-called migration background. Muslim young people are radicalizing more and faster than ever before. â€œI have never experienced anything like this,â€ says BÃ¼scher. â€œMilitant anti-Semitismâ€ is sometimes a nice way of describing it. 

â€œFirst we cut the throats of the Jews, then the gays, and finally the Christians,â€ a young Arab recently told him. BÃ¼scher tried to counteract this with small gestures: 

He pinned a small Israel flag on the lapel of his jacket. A 12-year-old saw this and then told the social worker: â€œI hate you. Weâ€™ll take the country back.â€

â€œBildâ€ newspaper shows that since the Hamas terrorist group massacred 1,200 Israelis, open hatred of Jews has become the norm in German schoolyards. â€œThe integration went wrong. We hardly reach young people anymore,â€ says Herford teacher Birgit Ebel.

She reports that radical organizations â€” such as the Muslim Brotherhood or the extremist Turkish â€œGray Wolvesâ€ â€” systematically try to recruit young people near schools and mosques.

Apparently with success: When Ebel observed a pro-Hamas rally and spotted some of her students in the demonstration, they shouted to their teacher: â€œMs. Ebel, you Jewish whore.â€

BÃ¼scher says he sees little chance of reaching Muslim young people. â€œWith the very young, conversations can still work. It no longer works for older teenagers. They reject our culture, our values,â€ he says.

And the man for whom youth welfare was his lifeâ€™s work then adds, visibly depressed: â€œThe hatred is unimaginable.â€

Arenâ€™t these the guardians of â€œgood and evilâ€ who shouted that we have room? Or does the sentence apply again, as it did after the lost final victory in 1945â€¦ or the findings after the great pandemic?

Every thinking person could have predicted this development since 2015 at the latest. I assume that this Mr. Wolfgang BÃ¼scher and Ms. Birgit Ebel were at the forefront of defaming AfD politicians and their supporters as Nazis. 

It is exactly this type of person who, with the best of intentions, does exactly the wrong thing because they DO NOT THINK further than their feelings. 

They are probably only now starting to think about what they (the do-gooders) did wrong in their integration work and how they can change it for the better of society. 

Rest assured, they have only made one mistake in that regard, and that is to believe that Muslims, who despise us and our culture, can be integrated into our way of life. Just as they will not be able to turn a wolf into a vegetarian, they will not be able to integrate Muslims into Western society. 

Although Iâ€™m pretty sure that their solution will be that Muslims donâ€™t have to integrate with us; thatâ€™s not necessary, but that we need to integrate with THEM.

I say NO, we will not bow to those who want to do us harm. The consequence for Muslims must be that they have to leave our countries, period. 

After all, you donâ€™t let a fox spend the night in the chicken coop, even if there are 1,000 hens in there, now, do you?
